studies.study_title: MDMA-Assisted Therapy for PTSD: Phase 3 Trial Results
studies.citation: Mitchell JM, Bogenschutz M, Lilienstein A, et al. 2021. Nature Medicine.
studies.title: MDMA-Assisted Therapy for PTSD: Phase 3 Trial Results
studies.authors: Mitchell JM, Bogenschutz M, Lilienstein A, et al.

intervention.cannabinoid: MDMA (comparator study - contextual for cannabis research)

outcomes.results: 67% no longer met PTSD criteria vs 32% placebo; Sets precedent for psychoactive therapy FDA approval
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Functional improvement; depression reduced; disability decreased

safety.adverse_events: Transient: jaw clenching, nausea, decreased appetite

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - FDA Breakthrough Therapy; establishes psychoactive substance pathway for PTSD

studies.study_title: Nabilone for PTSD-Related Nightmares in Military Veterans
studies.citation: Jetly R, Heber A, Fraser G, et al. 2015. Psychoneuroendocrinology.
studies.title: Nabilone for PTSD-Related Nightmares in Military Veterans
studies.authors: Jetly R, Heber A, Fraser G, et al.

outcomes.results: Nabilone: 72% nightmare reduction vs Placebo: 13%; CAPS improved from 24.6 to 9.0 (p<0.001)
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Sleep quality improved; global clinical impression improved; CGI-C 70% much improved

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - FDA-approved drug (nabilone); military veteran population; treatment-resistant nightmares

studies.study_title: Smoked Cannabis for PTSD: First Randomized Placebo-Controlled Trial
studies.citation: Bonn-Miller MO, Sisley SE, Riggs P, et al. 2021. PLOS ONE.
studies.title: Smoked Cannabis for PTSD: First Randomized Placebo-Controlled Trial
studies.authors: Bonn-Miller MO, Sisley SE, Riggs P, et al.

intervention.cannabinoid: Smoked cannabis (High THC, High CBD, THC+CBD, Placebo)

outcomes.results: All groups improved; High THC: -9.4 points; No significant between-group differences (high placebo response)
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: PTSD symptom clusters all improved; functional improvement noted

safety.adverse_events: Cannabis intoxication effects; cough; dry mouth

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - First FDA IND for smoked cannabis PTSD trial; establishes feasibility; informs future design

studies.study_title: Medical Cannabis and PTSD: Large Prospective Registry Study
studies.citation: Shishko I, Oliveira R, Moore TA, et al. 2018. Journal of Psychopharmacology.
studies.title: Medical Cannabis and PTSD: Large Prospective Registry Study
studies.authors: Shishko I, Oliveira R, Moore TA, et al.
studies.sample_size: 404 PTSD patients in medical cannabis program

outcomes.results: 75% reduction in PTSD symptoms at 12 months; PCL-5 mean reduction of 28 points; 63% no longer met criteria
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Sleep improved 68%; anxiety reduced 71%; depression improved 58%

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Large real-world evidence; 12-month outcomes; supports medical cannabis for PTSD

studies.study_title: Cannabinoids for PTSD: Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
studies.citation: Hindocha C, Cousijn J, Rall M, et al. 2020. Journal of Dual Diagnosis.
studies.title: Cannabinoids for PTSD: Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
studies.authors: Hindocha C, Cousijn J, Rall M, et al.

outcomes.results: Overall benefit for PTSD symptoms; Nightmares most responsive (SMD = -0.89); Global symptoms improved (SMD = -0.51)
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Sleep particularly responsive; hyperarousal reduced; re-experiencing symptoms improved

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - Meta-analytic confirmation; nightmare-specific efficacy; supports targeted indication

studies.study_title: Cannabis Use and PTSD Symptom Reduction: Veteran Population Study
studies.citation: LaFrance EM, Glodosky NC, Bonn-Miller M, et al. 2020. Journal of Affective Disorders.
studies.title: Cannabis Use and PTSD Symptom Reduction: Veteran Population Study
studies.authors: LaFrance EM, Glodosky NC, Bonn-Miller M, et al.

outcomes.primary_measure: Acute symptom change with cannabis use
outcomes.results: 62% reduction in intrusions; 57% reduction in flashbacks; 51% reduction in anxiety; 67% reduction in irritability
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Avoidance symptoms improved; hypervigilance reduced; mood improved

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Veteran-focused; acute symptom relief documented; supports therapeutic use

studies.study_title: Endocannabinoid System and Fear Extinction: Implications for PTSD
studies.citation: Rabinak CA, Angstadt M, Sripada CS, et al. 2013. Neuropsychopharmacology.
studies.title: Endocannabinoid System and Fear Extinction: Implications for PTSD
studies.authors: Rabinak CA, Angstadt M, Sripada CS, et al.

outcomes.results: THC enhanced fear extinction recall; Reduced amygdala reactivity to extinguished fear cues; vmPFC-amygdala connectivity enhanced
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Extinction retention improved 24h later; suggests therapeutic mechanism for PTSD

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - NIH-funded; explains cannabinoid PTSD mechanism; supports exposure therapy enhancement

studies.study_title: Medical Cannabis Authorization and PTSD Symptoms: Canadian Longitudinal Study
studies.citation: Turna J, Patterson B, Van Ameringen M. 2017. Journal of Clinical Psychiatry.
studies.title: Medical Cannabis Authorization and PTSD Symptoms: Canadian Longitudinal Study
studies.authors: Turna J, Patterson B, Van Ameringen M

outcomes.results: PCL-5 reduced from 56.7 to 38.2 (33% reduction, p<0.001); 75% achieved clinically meaningful improvement
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Sleep quality improved; nightmare frequency reduced 41%; depression scores improved

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Treatment-resistant population; rapid improvement; Canadian medical system context

studies.study_title: VA/DoD Clinical Practice Guideline for PTSD: Cannabis Considerations
studies.citation: VA/DoD Clinical Practice Guideline Working Group. 2023. Department of Veterans Affairs.
studies.title: VA/DoD Clinical Practice Guideline for PTSD: Cannabis Considerations
studies.authors: VA/DoD Clinical Practice Guideline Working Group

outcomes.results: Acknowledges veteran cannabis use; notes emerging evidence; recommends neither for nor against pending further RCT data
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Calls for more research; acknowledges nightmare reduction potential; notes state legalization considerations

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - Official VA/DoD position; shapes federal research priorities; veteran-focused

studies.study_title: CBD for PTSD: Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial
studies.citation: Elms L, Shannon S, Hughes S, et al. 2019. Journal of Alternative and Complementary Medicine.
studies.title: CBD for PTSD: Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial
studies.authors: Elms L, Shannon S, Hughes S, et al.
studies.journal: Journal of Alternative and Complementary Medicine

outcomes.results: 91% (10/11) experienced symptom reduction; Mean PCL-5 decreased 28%; Nightmares improved in all patients
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Sleep improved; anxiety reduced; well-tolerated; no THC psychoactivity

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - CBD-specific; non-psychoactive option; 91% response; supports larger RCT
